qas.question: When did the band The Darkness break up?
The Sword, High on Fire, Witchcraft and Wolfmother are all examples of what hard rock sub-genre?
What is the title of Airbourne's debut lp?
Glam metal band Steel Panther is from what city?
What are some Swedish sleaze metal revivalist bands?

answers.text: Vains of Jenna, Hardcore Superstar and Crashdïet

qas.question: What type of hard rock music is based in Texas and California?
Which band that debut in 2005 sang songs written by Deep Purple and Led Zeppelin?
What album did AC/DC produce in 2007 that displayed their hard riffing tradition?

plausible_answers.text: England's The Darkness' Permission to Land

qas.question: What album from 2003 was described as a simulation of 70s metal and 80s glam?
What country was a serious attempt to revive punk rock attempted?

context: The term "<a1_0><b5_0>retro-metal<b5_0/><a1_0/>" has been applied to such bands as Texas based The Sword, California's High on Fire, Sweden's Witchcraft and Australia's Wolfmother. <b6_0>Wolfmother<b6_0/>'s self-titled 2005 debut album combined elements of the sounds of Deep Purple and Led Zeppelin. Fellow Australians Airbourne's début album <a2_0><b7_0>Runnin' Wild<b7_0/><a2_0/> (2007) followed in the hard riffing tradition of AC/DC. <b8_0>England's The Darkness' Permission to Land<b8_0/> (2003), described as an "eerily realistic simulation of '80s metal and '70s glam", topped the UK charts, going quintuple platinum. The follow-up, One Way Ticket to Hell... and Back (2005), reached number 11, before the band broke up in <a0_0>2006<a0_0/>. <a3_0>Los Angeles<a3_0/> band Steel Panther managed to gain a following by sending up 80s glam metal. A more serious attempt to revive glam metal was made by bands of the sleaze metal movement in <b9_0>Sweden<b9_0/>, including <a4_0>Vains of Jenna, Hardcore Superstar and Crashdïet<a4_0/>.
